caption: b"We celebrate the grand opening of NRC-Mississauga, a new facility beside our own research center in Ontario that we worked on with the National Research Council of Canada (@nrc_cnrc). It's part of the larger Canadian Campus for Advanced Materials Manufacturing where scientists will be working on clean technologies, additive manufacturing/3D printing and more. Link in bio."
b'Print up to 25% faster and in vivid neon fluorescent ink, silver, white and gold with the new Xerox Versant 280. Learn more at the link in our bio.'
b'This holiday season, print in sparkling silver and gold with Xerox metallic dry ink. Learn more at the link in our bio.'

b'What happens when you combine high-speed inkjet printing with deeper, more vibrant colors and support for a whole new range of media? Introducing the Color Accelerator for Xerox Baltoro. Dreams do come true. Read more at the link in our bio.'

b'Announced today: the new Color Accelerator for Xerox Baltoro delivers richer, more vibrant, lifelike colors for inkjet printing by using advanced software to drop ink precisely from over 65,000 nozzles! More product info in bio. #DreamsInPrintOut'

b'To encourage students of color to pursue careers in science, tech, engineering & math, Xerox is partnering with @ABetterChance to provide professional mentorship opportunities from our employees. Our goal: To increase representation in #STEM fields from current rates of 7-9% in the workforce at large.'

b"Only two days left until we take the wrappers off 5 new products and 4 new features. Don't miss our #DreamsInPrintsOut event. Livestreaming free globally on Wednesday, November 18 at 11 am ET. Link in bio."
b'Want to give your printed creations a glow up? Try Xerox fluorescent ink. Find out more at the link in our bio.'

b"Mark your calendars: on Wednesday, Nov. 18, we're hosting a free, live global virtual event to reveal something truly special & exciting -- especially for production printers. Register now with the link in our bio!"

b"Happy Halloween! It's an unusual year, but you can still celebrate the trickiest of holidays by making cards, decorations and other printed creations glow with eerie fluorescent ink. Find out how with Xerox Adaptive CMYK+ tech. Link in bio. #BeyondCMYK"

b'In announcing Q3 earnings today, Xerox Vice Chairman and CEO John Visentin shared how investments in digital solutions and services are helping customers prepare for a more hybrid work experience. Read the full release at the link in our bio.'

b'Oceans cover the majority of Earth\xe2\x80\x99s surface, but we still know relatively little about their inner workings. Scientists at @PARC, a Xerox Company are working to change that by partnering with @Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) on a program to deploy drifting ocean sensors that collect data on the environment and human impact. Read more at https://xerox.bz/2TeEJoi.'

b'Oceans cover the majority of Earth\xe2\x80\x99s surface, but we still know relatively little about their inner workings. Scientists at @PARC, a Xerox Company are working to change that by partnering with @Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) on a program to deploy drifting ocean sensors that collect data on the environment and human impact. Read more at https://xerox.bz/2TeEJoi.'

b'"I\'m always looking for unique," says graffiti artist Gustavo Oviedo(@1_3_1), who uses vibrant fluorescent colors in his paintings. Now you can print in fluorescents too. See how with the new, award-winning Xerox Adaptive CMYK+ Kit. More info at the link in our bio. #BeyondCMYK'

b"My how times have changed: You're looking at one of the first computer interfaces designed for ordinary people to use -- the Smalltalk 76 for Xerox Alto computer -- made by researchers at our lab XEROX PARC in the early 1970s. Most of the digital devices we use today were influenced in some way by these early Xerox GUIs. PARC is celebrating 50 years this year and still going strong: swipe right to see a newer Xerox ConnectKey printer interface with Apps and look how far we've come. #throwbackthursday #PARC50 #TheNext50"

b'Looking to produce prints that really sparkle and shine with Xerox Iridesse? Tune into our free live webinar on Oct. 21 to learn how to to easily add metallic embellishments to new and existing designs! Feat. special guests from @colorlogic and @onestepprinting. Register now: Link in bio.'

b"From spot color that prints your company's logo and branding accurately on all types of materials to incredible, eye-popping fluorescents, metallics and clear ink, learn how to use your Xerox iGen 5 like a pro in our new webinar Nov. 4, featuring @CatPrint! Registration link in bio."

b'Halloween is less than a month away! This year will be different, but you can still get ready for the spooky season by printing out Halloween decorations and cards using Xerox metallic, fluorescent and white dry ink. See more in our bio. #BeyondCMYK'

b"A gold medal for gold ink? Close enough. We're so thrilled the Xerox Adaptive CMYK+ Kit for our Versant printers, which lets you print in gold, silver, fluorescent and clear glaze, has been recognized with a Buyers Lab award for Outstanding Innovation! More info. on this product and our color tech at the link in our bio."

b'We believe in fostering workplaces where all people are equal, belong and thrive. This is one of the reasons we support @outandequal Summit, which starts today. Speakers will discuss critical topics ranging from racial justice to belonging in the workplace, and so much more. Join the conversation. #OESummit'

b'Boldly going where no printer has gone before\xe2\x80\xa6 Xerox is proud to be recognized by @printingunited with a 2020 InterTech Technology Award for the Baltoro HF! This printer\xe2\x80\x99s high-fusion ink moves the industry forward, delivering vibrant results.'

b'Today, we officially open our North Carolina Center of Excellence in @townofcary, NC. At Xerox, we have long defined the modern work experience and this space will continue to build on our legacy. We\xe2\x80\x99ve incorporated the latest collaborative technologies and layouts. This facility is designed to foster innovation and will be the new home of Xerox\xe2\x80\x99s IT organization. \n\nThe NC Center of Excellence is located in the Research Triangle, one of the top tech communities in the world. Its location is a key component to our ongoing digital transformation and we look forward to partnering with talent from some of the best universities in the country!'

b"Why do fluorescent colors appear so bright? It's all thanks to molecules called fluorphores that absorb light, become excited, and emit a glow. Excite audiences with your own glowing creations. Check out the new Xerox Adaptive CMYK+ accessory for Versant printers. #beyondcmyk"
b'For graphic design that truly pushes the envelope: print in gold, silver, fluorescent, even clear with our Adaptive CMYK+ technology. #beyondcmyk'
b'Adapt to a new world of color. Xerox lets you print gold, silver, fluorescent--up to a million different possibilities. #BeyondCMYK'

b'Transfer information between the cloud and paper easily, quickly and securely. Xerox ConnectKey tech lets you scan to and print directly from Google Drive, Microsoft Outlook and more of your favorite productivity apps.'

b'When it comes to personalization, it\xe2\x80\x99s always better to think outside the box. See how ZoxxBox used Xerox technology to grow their business by creating custom sustainable packaging at scale for their customers. #MakeNowWork'
b'Same printer, a million new color possibilities. The new Xerox Adaptive CMYK+ kit for Versant is here. #BeyondCMYK'

b'This summer, Rocky Mountain Public Media (@rmpbs) finished construction of its new headquarters on time, despite disruption from COVID-19 \xe2\x80\x94 with help from Xerox IT Services. Find out more at the link in our bio.'

b'How does one organization keep up with nearly 3,000 new paper applications per day? HM Land Registry in the UK trusts Xerox Capture & Content services to digitize them securely. More at link in bio.'

b'A printer that can do yoga is a stretch, but the new Xerox AltaLink C8100/B8100 is built to empower a flexible workforce, with remote functionality, cloud storage, workflow automation, comprehensive security, and direct access to a suite of Xerox apps. Learn more at the link in bio.'

b'Meet your new digital workplace assistant, the Xerox AltaLink C8100/B8100 Series with ConnectKey Apps and Automation. It may not be able to walk your dog, but it is designed to support your team in and out of the office. Learn more at the link in bio.'

b"Struggling to keep tabs on your team? The new Xerox Team Availability App easily tracks who's free, where they are, and how they're feeling in real time so your flexible workplace always runs smoothly.  Learn more at the link in bio."

b"We opened our groundbreaking Silicon Valley research lab PARC 50 years ago, which developed some of the first computer interfaces, touchscreens, invented ethernet and the laser printer, and more. Over the coming weeks, we'll give you a preview of what we're inventing for #TheNext50."

b'Flexible work arrangements call for versatile devices. Meet the Xerox AltaLink 8100 Series Printer, and get ready to transform your workplace \xe2\x80\x93 wherever it is. Learn more at the link in bio.'

b'Your office may be a ghost town right now, but that won\xe2\x80\x99t last forever. b"\xe2\x80\x9cWhite might be the most evocative color because it can take on so many different forms,\xe2\x80\x9d says Jeff Goodby, creator of the legendary 'Got Milk' campaign, in our new video. Watch and discover its range. #BeyondCMYK"

b'Remote work, office, or a blend of both. Whatever path your business takes, you need a content management system that can support people working in multiple locations at once. Try Xerox DocuShare Flex free for 60 days.'

b'Market forces have suddenly created new opportunities for innovative cleantech. What\xe2\x80\x99s next? Xerox researchers at PARC, celebrating 50 years this summer, are building a more sustainable future.'
b'Xerox PARC invented the modern work experience, a task that\xe2\x80\x99s even more vital today. The mission continues at PARC, celebrating its 50th anniversary this year, and across the globe.'

b'Our commitment to tech innovation is why we founded our lab PARC, a Xerox Company, 50 years ago. And it continues today with Xerox scientists developing new technologies like 3D printing, AI, and more. Check out the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'See how Xerox systems engineer Kevin St. Martin got some special help from his "assistants" -- including his second grader and 10-year-old dog Emma -- while working from his home garage. b'Your organization is adapting to working remotely. Now your documents can, too. Share, store, edit and collaborate on files in a secure cloud accessible on computer and mobile. Try Xerox DocuShare Flex free for 60 days using the link in our bio.'

b"At Xerox, our commitment to sustainability is older than Earth Day itself, going back more than 50 years. From introducing power down mode for our technology to pioneering remanufacturing for office equipment, we've evaluated the potential environmental, health, and safety impacts of our products across the entire product lifecycle. \xe2\x80\x9cOur practices of understanding these impacts and taking responsibility for mitigating them have gone hand-in-hand from the very beginning,\xe2\x80\x9d says Wendi Latko, Vice President, Environment, Health, Safety & Sustainability.\n\nThis photo is of a real living wall at our office in Uxbridge, UK."

b'The person who invented shortcuts you use every day\xe2\x80\x94such as cut, copy and paste, find and replace, and more\xe2\x80\x94was a Xerox researcher named Larry Tesler. Your workday is easier thanks to Larry\xe2\x80\x99s elegantly simple yet revolutionary ideas. Larry passed away Monday, so please join us in celebrating his innovative mind and groundbreaking work. Photo credit: Yahoo CC-By-2.0.'

b'Congratulations to Xerox engineers Mike Soures & Erwin Ruiz for their nomination as \xe2\x80\x98Inventors of the Year\xe2\x80\x99 by the Rochester Intellectual Property Law Association!

They enabled the Xerox Nuvera to print on light paper stock in high humidity environments using a clever puff of air. Their solution involves aerodynamics, physics and ingenuity.  As Soures describes the challenge: In high-humidity regions like Asia-Pacific, the printer was struggling with the moisture in the air. \xe2\x80\x9cBecause of the humidity, you couldn\xe2\x80\x99t get the physical marks on the paper because it wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t lie flat.\xe2\x80\x9d Another challenge was the lightness of the light paper stock. \xe2\x80\x9cMost of our stackers today rely on the paper\xe2\x80\x99s stiffness to complete the stacking motion, but since this lighter-weight paper was weak and flimsy, it just collapsed,\xe2\x80\x9d says Ruiz.

How did they overcome the challenges? \xe2\x80\x9cWe realized that we could re-optimize the design of the system, with some of the same technology components already in the printer,\xe2\x80\x9d says Soures, shrinking the zone and changing where the transfer on ink to paper was happening.

Also, to help stack, the engineers \xe2\x80\x9ccreated a puff of air underneath the paper at a specific timing to overcompensate for the lack of stiffness and help the paper flip and lie completely flat,\xe2\x80\x9d says Ruiz.

Who knew printing on paper could be so complex? But as Ruiz and Soures show, Xerox engineers are well prepared to come up with creative solutions that advance the industry.'

b'Xerox is committed to sustainability from start to finish. We were pleased to accept a Gold Tier award from the @epagov at #CES2020 for responsible management of electronic waste. We send 100% of used electronics to recyclers. Last year alone, that was 15,000 tons!'
